meanings.definition: In a way that distributes or divides among several or many
meanings.sent1: The candies were distributively shared among the children at the party.
meanings.sent2: The teacher handed out the worksheets distributively to each student in the class.
meanings.sent3: The ants distributively carried away the crumbs from the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The wind distributively scattered the leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The seeds were distributively planted in neat rows in the garden.

meanings.sent1: The twins distributively completed their homework in their own rooms.
meanings.sent2: Each ingredient was added distributively to the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces were distributively sorted into different piles.
meanings.sent4: The stars shone distributively in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The students worked distributively on their art projects.
